publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5596♦ Mr Alasdair Morrison: Celebrating Success—That the Parliament welcomes the substantive progress being made in tackling sectarianism in Scotland; commends the initiatives undertaken by Scotland’s largest football clubs, Rangers FC and Celtic FC, to counter sectarian attitudes; congratulates the football clubs on their initiatives, Pride over Prejudice and Bhoys Against Bigotry; notes the success of their highly commendable joint educational programme, the Old Firm Alliance, within Glasgow schools; recognises that the significant progress achieved in tackling sectarianism represents a continuing determination by both clubs to help eradicate the problem, and also commends the informal arrangements between old firm supporters in the Western Isles as an example for the rest of the country.
S2M-5596♦ Celebrating Success (lodged on 14 February 2007) Tommy Sheridan*

S2M-5596♦ Mr Alasdair Morrison: Celebrating Success—That the Parliament welcomes the substantive progress being made in tackling sectarianism in Scotland; commends the initiatives undertaken by Scotland’s largest football clubs, Rangers FC and Celtic FC, to counter sectarian attitudes; congratulates the football clubs on their initiatives, Pride over Prejudice and Bhoys Against Bigotry; notes the success of their highly commendable joint educational programme, the Old Firm Alliance, within Glasgow schools; recognises that the significant progress achieved in tackling sectarianism represents a continuing determination by both clubs to help eradicate the problem, and also commends the informal arrangements between old firm supporters in the Western Isles as an example for the rest of the country. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Mr Duncan McNeil*

S2M-5596*#* Mr Alasdair Morrison: Celebrating Success—That the Parliament welcomes the substantive progress being made in tackling sectarianism in Scotland; commends the initiatives undertaken by Scotland’s largest football clubs, Rangers FC and Celtic FC, to counter sectarian attitudes; congratulates the football clubs on their initiatives, Pride over Prejudice and Bhoys Against Bigotry; notes the success of their highly commendable joint educational programme, the Old Firm Alliance, within Glasgow schools; recognises that the significant progress achieved in tackling sectarianism represents a continuing determination by both clubs to help eradicate the problem, and also commends the informal arrangements between old firm supporters in the Western Isles as an example for the rest of the country. Supported by: Scott Barrie*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Maureen Macmillan*, Mr Jim Wallace*, John Home Robertson*, Mr Jamie Stone*, David McLetchie*, Dennis Canavan*, Mr Charlie Gordon*, Nora Radcliffe*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Margaret Jamieson*, Jackie Baillie*, Bill Butler*, Donald Gorrie* Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support
S2M-5596# Celebrating Success (lodged on 14 February 2007) Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Karen Gillon*, Bristow Muldoon*, John Swinburne*, Ms Wendy Alexander*, Eleanor Scott*, Paul Martin*, Rosie Kane*
S2M-5596# Celebrating Success (lodged on 14 February 2007) Frances Curran*, Dr Jean Turner*
S2M-5596# Celebrating Success (lodged on 14 February 2007) Cathy Peattie*
S2M-5596# Celebrating Success (lodged on 14 February 2007) Michael McMahon*
S2M-5596# Celebrating Success (lodged on 14 February 2007) Chris Ballance*

S2M-5596# Mr Alasdair Morrison: Celebrating Success—That the Parliament welcomes the substantive progress being made in tackling sectarianism in Scotland; commends the initiatives undertaken by Scotland’s largest football clubs, Rangers FC and Celtic FC, to counter sectarian attitudes; congratulates the football clubs on their initiatives, Pride over Prejudice and Bhoys Against Bigotry; notes the success of their highly commendable joint educational programme, the Old Firm Alliance, within Glasgow schools; recognises that the significant progress achieved in tackling sectarianism represents a continuing determination by both clubs to help eradicate the problem, and also commends the informal arrangements between old firm supporters in the Western Isles as an example for the rest of the country. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Mr Duncan McNeil, Scott Barrie, Dr Elaine Murray, Maureen Macmillan, Mr Jim Wallace, John Home Robertson, Mr Jamie Stone, David McLetchie, Dennis Canavan, Mr Charlie Gordon, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Margaret Jamieson, Jackie Baillie, Bill Butler, Donald Gorrie, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Karen Gillon, Bristow Muldoon, John Swinburne, Ms Wendy Alexander, Eleanor Scott, Paul Martin, Rosie Kane, Frances Curran, Dr Jean Turner, Cathy Peattie, Michael McMahon, Chris Ballance
S2M-5596# Celebrating Success (lodged on 14 February 2007) Trish Godman*
